meanings.definition: Relating to the earliest period of the Stone Age.
meanings.sent1: The eolithic tools were very basic and simple.
meanings.sent2: Archaeologists study eolithic artifacts to learn about ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The eolithic tools looked like they were made by children playing with rocks.
meanings.sent4: In the eolithic era, survival depended on mastering stone tools.
meanings.sent5: The eolithic period marked the beginning of human tool-making history.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the cultural period characterized by the use of unpolished stone tools.
meanings.sent1: The eolithic tools were rough and unrefined.
meanings.sent2: People in the eolithic age used stone tools for hunting and gathering.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see how eolithic tools evolved into more sophisticated ones.
meanings.sent4: The eolithic craftsmanship reflected the resourcefulness of early humans.
meanings.sent5: The eolithic culture valued practicality over aesthetics in tool-making.
